author: timbeiko
content: <@199561711278227457> <@755590043632140352> I do sympathize with <@557201004060213248>'s PoV here, especially in cases where we have an open validator set. That said, maybe one thing we could do for Sepolia (and other closed validator testnets) going forward is to make it clear what response time we expect from operators for this.

author: timbeiko
content: Obviously, validators aren't the only users of Sepolia, but if it's clear when people sign up as (or remain) Sepolia validators, they are expected to upgrade their nodes in 1 week in regular times and X days in an emergency, then we can have aligned expectations.

author: parithosh
content:
Yeah agreed that we can't do anything for a fully public testnet, but i guess its worth re-iterating the commitment for closed validator set networks. 

We did so shortly after genesis: https://github.com/eth-clients/sepolia/issues/12

Linked validator expectation doc: https://notes.ethereum.org/@parithosh/HkVjQfkc5 (The numbers are suuuuper vague and outdated. I'm quite sure we can make them more concrete based on what validators agree and reference that for the future). Also probably best to move that somewhere more easily accessible.
